page.title: 11 FARMING-OUTWOOD AREA
page.content: AFTER FINDING OUT WHERE THE FARMS IN OUR AREA WERE, WE CHOSE A BEEF FARM AND AN ARABLE FARM. CASTLE HEAD FARM-LAND COVERS 170 ACRES OF WHICH 15 ACRES ARE GIVEN TO WHEAT, 15 TO POTATOES,20 TO LETTUCE,10 TO BROCCOLI,25 TO CABBAGE,50 TO RHUBARB, AND 40 TO CAULIFLOWER. WHEN THE PRODUCE HAS BEEN HARVESTED IT IS PACKED INTO BOXES AND TAKEN BY THREE OF THEIR OWN LORRIES TO MARKETS THROUGHOUT THE COUNTRY,ON A TWICE WEEKLY BASIS.THE LORRIES TRAVEL TO LEEDS,BARNSLEY,MANCHESTER,BRADFORD,AND BRISTOL BEING DRIVEN BY EMPLOYEES OF THE FARM.THE PRODUCTION OF WHEAT IS DONE BY A CONTRACTOR,WHO HARVESTS IT AND TAKES IT TO A LOCAL CORN MERCHANT IN WAKEFIELD.THE FARMER EMPLOYS MANY STAFF ON A PERMANENT BASIS FOR WORK THROUGHOUT THE YEAR.
